stem: Given question: James and Ruth were getting a divorce.  It was amicable, but it wasn't happy.  There was a lot of what emotion? and answer: sadness, explain why in
no_more_50_words: Divorces are difficult, and even the amicable ones are sad as they signify the end of relationships.
50_to_100_words: James and Ruth's divorce, while amicable, is likely to have been a source of sadness for both of them. Going through a divorce can be a difficult and emotional process, regardless of the circumstances. Even when a couple has decided that it is best for them to separate, they may still feel sadness and loss at the end of their relationship. The emotions can be more intense if they have shared a lot of memories together. The ending of a marriage can also bring up feelings of failure and disappointment, which can contribute to sadness as well. Additionally, it may also make them sad that they could not make the marriage work, despite their best efforts.
